DOC.brief_title: Quality Life After Ministernotomy Versus Full Sternotomy Aortic Valve Replacement
DOC.detailed_description: This single-center , single-blind , comer , randomize control trial . Patients schedule isolated aortic valve replacement ( AVR ) due aortic stenosis `` Virgen de la Victoria Universitary Hospital '' , Málaga , Spain , eligible . Ninety-six patient randomly assign either partial upper sternotomy ( ministernotomy , 48 patient ) full sternotomy AVR ( 48 patient ) . Sample size determine Alpha error 0.05 , Beta error 0.1 power 90 % detect 0.10 difference point quality life EQ-5D-5L-index 10 point EQ-5D-5L-Visual Analogic Scale . Inclusion criterion severe aortic stenosis refer medically indicate isolated aortic valve replacement due aortic stenosis patient > 18 year . Exclusion criterion leave ventricular ejection fraction le 40 % , previous cardiac surgery , urgent/emergent surgery , infective endocarditis , need concomitant procedure isolate Morrow miectomy thorax deformity . CE-marked FDA-approved mechanical ( Sorin Carbomedics® ) stented bioprosthetic aortic valve implant ( Carpentier Edwards Perimount® Sorin Crown® ) . Perceval S Sutureless bioprosthetic valve ( LivaNova® ) could use need small aortic annulus high risk patient Quality Life postoperative outcome assess , QOL measurements health status EQ-5D-5L® questionnaire ( QOL index , health visual analogic scale , severity index health index ) , repeatedly assess preoperatively postoperatively hospital discharge , 1-6-12 month . Clinical postoperative complication outcomes register 1 month 1 year main secondary safety end-point ( combine end-point 6 major complication ) Patient Satisfaction assess 20 question cardiac-surgery specific satisfaction questionnaire ( SATISCORE® ) .
